what: Step 1: CombinedPar Function to Calculate Combined Distances and t-SNE
title: Mass Spectrometry Pre-Processing Guide
text: CombinedPar function designed analyze data calculating two types distances (Spearman Dissimilarity Euclidean Distance) simultaneously. utilizing separate CPU cores, function helps reduce processing time, making analysis efficient. , allptmtable.df data frame containing mass spectrometry data, allptmtable refers labels additional information relevant data. result, combined_data, contains processed output used next steps. Printing result helps verify function run correctly.
code: combined_data <- CombinedPar(allptmtable.df, allptmtable) print("Combined data:") print(combined_data)

title: Mass Spectrometry Pre-Processing Guide
text: obtaining combined data previous step, MakeClusterList function employed identify clusters within dataset. Clustering important step data analysis, allowing group similar observations (case, genes) based characteristics. helps understanding relationships data. output, cluster_list, show genes grouped together, enabling see relate visually next steps. Important Note: Avoid altering output files’ data types, can affect subsequent analyses.

title: Mass Spectrometry Pre-Processing Guide
text: step uses output MakeClusterList function find common clusters among data. FindCommonCluster function analyzes cluster list generates visual graph represents relationships among clusters. graph particularly useful visualizing different gene clusters overlap, providing insights biological similarities.

title: Mass Spectrometry Pre-Processing Guide
text: step, GenerateAndConstructAllptmsNetwork function takes common clusters identified previous step create network Post-Translational Modifications (PTMs). PTMs chemical modifications occur protein produced, understanding modifications crucial many biological processes. function merges cluster data single comprehensive data frame, preparing analysis. step essential connecting dots different protein modifications.

title: Mass Spectrometry Pre-Processing Guide
text: BindMatrices function aligns adjacency matrix (represents relationships different entities) correlation matrix (indicates closely related different observations ). setting diagonal connections NA, function helps clean data ensures relevant relationships analyzed.

title: Mass Spectrometry Pre-Processing Guide
text: Finally, CorrelationNetwork function takes bound matrices transforms igraph object. object represents network nodes correspond genes proteins, edges represent relationships . Analyzing correlation network allows understand complex interactions different proteins dataset, offering insights functional relationships.

Defaults "plots".
